intro: Carpacoce scabra subsp. scabra, commonly known as the rough carpacho, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a rough, textured surface, contributing to its common name. It is a relatively rare species, with limited distribution in certain regions of Europe.
